articles.title: charAt()
articles.description: The String object's charAt() method returns a new string consisting of the single UTF-16 code unit located at the specified offset into the string.

parameters.name: index
parameters.explanation: An integer between 0 and 1-less-than the length of the string. If no index is provided, the default is 0, so the first character in the string is returned.

syntax.return: A string representing the character (exactly one UTF-16 code unit) at the specified index; empty string if index is out of range.

articles.title: substring()
articles.description: The substring() method returns the part of the string between the start and end indexes, or to the end of the string.

parameters.name: indexStart
parameters.explanation: The index of the first character to include in the returned substring.

syntax.return: A new string containing the specified part of the given string.
